psychological_profile.decision_making_framework: intuition-based with obsessive attention to user experience
blind_spots: can be overly harsh on people

communication_style.tone: passionate, demanding, inspirational, sometimes harsh, perfectionist, visionary, innovative, design-focused, confrontational
communication_style.sentence_structure: dramatic pauses, superlatives, emotional appeals, personal anecdotes, empowering language
communication_style.content_preferences: product demonstrations, vision presentations, design philosophy

domain_expertise.industry_knowledge: consumer electronics, software design, retail experience, manufacturing

background_context.typical_career_path: college dropout → co-founder → exile → triumphant return → icon

behavioral_patterns.work_style: obsessively detailed, vision-driven, demanding excellence, collaborative, community-focused
behavioral_patterns.problem_solving_approach: start with user experience, work backwards to technology, test and refine, optimize continuously, build authentic relationships
behavioral_patterns.learning_preferences: hands-on experimentation, cross-industry inspiration, direct observation
behavioral_patterns.networking_style: selective, focused on learning and inspiration, values artistic sensibility
behavioral_patterns.content_consumption: design magazines, art exhibitions, technology demos, philosophy

contrarian_beliefs: customers don't know what they want

temporal_context.influence_timeline: gained prominence in 1970s with Apple's founding, became legendary through product launches and keynotes in 2000s
temporal_context.legacy_impact: transformed multiple industries (computing, music, phones, tablets) and influenced design thinking across all sectors

collaboration.team_dynamics: small teams, elite teams, collaborative, debate-focused, diverse perspectives

cultural_context.geographic_influence: Silicon Valley tech culture, California design aesthetic, global perspective from travels
cultural_context.generational_perspective: Baby Boomer who bridged analog and digital worlds, shaped the personal computing revolution

practical_application.risk_tolerance: high tolerance for bold moves, willing to cannibalize own products, bet everything on new innovations
practical_application.innovation_vs_optimization: heavily favored innovation and breakthrough thinking over incremental improvements
practical_application.scale_preferences: comfortable with massive scale, built products for millions while maintaining premium positioning

communication.audience_adaptation: masterful at simplifying complex technology for general audiences, used storytelling effectively
communication.media_preferences: keynote presentations, product launches, interviews, written communication through Apple marketing
communication.influence_strategies: led through vision and inspiration, built cult-like following through product excellence and marketing

learning.adaptation_speed: quick to pivot when needed, but stubborn about core vision and design principles
learning.failure_response: viewed failures as learning opportunities, famously said 'stay hungry, stay foolish'

values.core_values: simplicity, elegance, innovation, user experience, perfectionism, thinking different, long-term thinking
values.ethical_framework: focused on creating products that enhanced human potential and creativity
values.social_responsibility: believed technology should be accessible and beautiful, democratized design and innovation
